main_definition: (personal) The speakers/writers, or the speaker/writer and at least one other person (not the person being addressed). (This is the exclusive we.)

meanings_and_examples.definition: (personal) The speakers/writers, or the speaker/writer and at least one other person (not the person being addressed). (This is the exclusive we.)
meanings_and_examples.example: As a team of researchers, we conducted extensive studies to ensure the accuracy of our findings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (personal) The speaker(s)/writer(s) and the person(s) being addressed. (This is the inclusive we.)
meanings_and_examples.example: When I say, 'We should plan a group outing for this weekend,' I am including myself along with you in making decisions about our activities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (personal) The speaker/writer alone. (This use of we is the editorial we, used by writers and others, including royalty—the royal we—as a less personal substitute for I. The reflexive case of this sense of we is ourself.)
meanings_and_examples.example: In his memoirs, he often wrote 'We have embarked on a new journey,' using the royal we to reflect his personal perspective.

meanings_and_examples.definition: (personal) The plural form of you, including everyone being addressed.
(personal, often considered patronising) A second- or third-person pronoun for a person in the speaker's care.
meanings_and_examples.example: How are we feeling this morning?
